headline: weather advisory in effect
description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect.

What:
Additional local snowfall accumulations of 10 to 15 cm.
Reduced visibility in heavy snow and local blowing snow.

When:
Continuing through Tuesday afternoon.

Additional information:
Heavy flurries will continue as a cold front passes through the area and lake effect snow develops in behind. Strong northwesterly winds gusting up to 70 km/h will also develop early this evening, further reducing visibility in local blowing snow. Flurries will weaken Tuesday afternoon.

###

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
instruction: Prepare for quickly changing and deteriorating travel conditions. If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop.

affected_areas.area_description: Owen Sound - Blue Mountains - Northern Grey County
